intro: Aeschynomene rostrata, commonly known as the narrowleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, followed by elongated, slender pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in various ecosystems.
